json.text: [ dramatic music ]
>> Man: CM Punk is a guy who recently signed with the UFC.
Now he doesn't have a wrestling pedigree.
He has more of a pro wrestling pedigree.
Do you think he could actually get to a level
of a UFC fighter in a few months to fight in the organization?
>> Man #2: This isn't WWE.
I mean no.
No, you're an idiot. You're gonna get hurt.
You deserve to get hurt to think that way.
>> Announcer: CM Punk!
>> Woman: WWE champion, CM Punk.
>> Man: CM Punk.
[ crowd chanting "CM Punk! ]
>> Joe Rogan: Is this a one time adventure
or are you considering this as your new career?
>> This is my new career and when it's all said and done,
when I'm finished, everybody is going to have to respect me
because I have come here to fight.
>> Michael Bisping: This isn't story time with mom and dad.
This is the real thing and he's going to learn
pretty hard and pretty fast
that this was a gigantic mistake
on his behalf.
>> Mike Goldberg: Anderson--oh, he got hit!
>> Joe: Oh, my God!
>> Mike: It's over!
>> Joe: He's going out.
>> Mike: And it's all over!
>> Joe: That's a wrap.
>> Mike: The mixed martial artist rules.
>> There are all these MMA purists who are up in arms
about it, about how I'm 0-0 and I'm getting this shot
in the UFC and it's not right and it's not fair.
Yeah, I'm not a black belt in anything.
I'm starting from the ground up.
There probably is a lot of making up I need to do,
but I wanted to just prove that I could do it.
I hope to inspire somebody.
I was definitely a bit of an outcast.
I didn't really fit in.
And you have kids like me all over the world who feel like
they don't fit in anywhere and they don't have a home.
If I can show somebody that they have what it takes to do
whatever it is somebody is telling them they can't
or shouldn't even try,
I'll feel way better about myself when I go to bed.
[ dramatic music ]
[ crowd chanting "CM Punk" ]
>> I'm pretty much driving to
an area of Wisconsin called West Allis, Wisconsin.
Being an independent wrestler,
I used to do this drive once, twice a month
in 1999 to like 2004.
An hour and a half drive for a guy like me is a cake walk.
I'm used to five-hour drives at midnight
getting to the next town.
So this is no problem.
If you put MMA on television as prominent as wrestling
was in the '80s, I mean I guarantee my life
would have taken a different path.
>> Alright, let's glove up.
Let's do this today.
>> Punk: Anthony Pettis fought Cerrone in Chicago
and I met Duke-- I actually sat with him
and pretty much his whole team.
He has been everywhere and has done everything.
He has been a champion.
He has coached champions.
Roufusport is the best team in MMA.
>> Roufus: Let's find out where you are at.
Alright, kick.
Let's start out.
Pop. Good-- don't put those hands together.
Kick.
Pop. Remember, step hard.
You can hit me hard. Come on.
Take your time.
Don't open yourself up though, remember?
I know you want to hit that bad boy hard,
but make sure you're protecting yourself, okay?
>> Punk: The great thing about me
not having trained super extensively,
I don't have any super bad habits
that Duke has to try to reverse engineer.
>> Roufus: Ready-- Step.
Good.
Start a little closer to me, champ.
>> Scott: The number one basic parry there is,
is the jab.
What you don't want to do, is try to stop it right here.
No room for error.
Don't do this.
Okay, now what?
Yeah, he's going to keep hitting.
You went backwards, Phil.
It will come.
This is actually harder than it looks.
>> Punk: Today I started getting a little bit
frustrated with myself.
>> Scott: Open up a little bit; don't be so--
You're almost trying to be too perfect, Punk.
Relax.
I always tell people, "Relax,
you're only going to get hit in the head."
You're not made of glass.
>> Punk: I think this training is super challenging
and I'm sore and I'm tired.
Today makes me feel like it's really all up in the air.
[ optimistic rock music ]
>> April: What did you get?
>> Punk: Doughnuts.
I got one plain glazed for you
because I know you like them.
>> Thank you.
>> There is one peanut butter chocolate pocket
or something.
There is like a cinnamon sugar cake doughnut and then
there's a Boston creme, which I'm probably going to eat.
>> I have to bare my mid-drift.
>> You don't have to.
>> On television.
>> Wear a one piece.
>> Punk: I met my wife in WWE.
She's just the most awesome human being that I have
probably ever met in my entire life.
I've ruined my fair share of relationships
because of pro wrestling.
All of a sudden, I had this precious thing
that I didn't want to ruin.
I got out and a big focus was my relationship with my wife
and my marriage and doing what I could to make sure
that was healthy and that was always a very important aspect
of my life going forward.
She's not the biggest MMA fan,
so she doesn't totally understand the differences.
But I just picture her thinking the worst.
I would get anxious thinking about telling her,
because I wasn't exactly sure what her reaction
was gonna be.
>> April: I will go to the fight.
I don't know if I'll be at the page or not,
but I'll be there.
I just don't enjoy seeing your face with bruises on it.
It's tough for me to watch.
>> Punk: It's what?
>> It's hard for me to watch.
>> Punk: Once I started explaining it to her,
she saw the spark and she immediately was like,
"Okay, cool.
I'm not gonna watch your fight,
but I support you 100 percent."
>> April: I'll just close my eyes the whole time.
>> What am I giving you?
There you go.
See how it just buckled the leg?
I'm showing you things.
Take advantage of it when I show it to you.
>> Punk: I got to work on a lot of stuff,
but I'm in there and I see feints
and I see him throwing stuff
and I know what it feels like to get hit.
I just got to get better all around.
>> Scott: Time.
Good work.
>> Punk: I got a ways to go.
>> Scott: You did some good things.
>> Punk: Thanks, coach.
>> April: You are going back at six?
>> Yeah.  >> Oh, okay.
>> Punk: I probably will be doing stuff until 7:30 or 8:00.
>> April: What are you going to do?
>> What?
>> April: What are you doing?
>> Same thing I did today.
Sparring.
What?
>> April: So does it involve getting hit in the eye?
>> Punk: Look at my face.
Do I have a googly eye?
>> You don't, not yet.
But you better not when you come back later.
>> I will be fine.
>> Okay.
I feel like I need to inspect you.
>> Punk: You did when you came in.
I could have told you I did jiu-jitsu today
and you would have been like "Ah."
>> But now I'm searching for some stuff.
Don't hit that face.
>> I don't hit my own face.
>> Don't let anyone hit that face.
That's my face.
I will go have a word with them.
>> The idea is to not get hit.
That's what I'm working on.
>> Is that the idea? >> That's what I'm working on.
>> One of these days I'll go with you and watch.
>> Punk: Okay. >> That day is not today.
I'm not ready.
I'm sorry.
>> Every time I want you to shut up,
I just kiss you.
>> It works.
>> Punk: It doesn't.
>> Pettis: Go!
Base, Punk. Get your base.
Tighten up and walk. Push him off.
You know what the technique is,
get off of him.
Nice. Reset.
Go crazy there.
Get him off.
I'm going to jump in too. See how I do it.
When I first started, I didn't worry about the detail,
I worried about the result.
So if you can be result driven,
the details will come as you get results.
So I want to get off my back.
Ten different ways to get off your back.
Which one works for you?
Keep going.
>> Punk: As a kid, I just remember there were many years
where there were barely any Christmas presents.
But my mother and father each had a carton
of cigarettes a week.
My dad had his case of beer
and my mom had her pills or what not.
I didn't understand like, "Why don't you help us first,
instead of helping yourself?"
I would try to not be around as much as I possibly could
and eventually I just never came home.
When you go to a public high school,
there's the jocks, there's the nerds--you know,
what else is there?
I was somewhere in-between.
I didn't really fit in with any group.
It didn't get any stranger than me.
When I was 15, I discovered there was a youth subculture
called straight edge.
And I read that and I went, "Oh hey, that's me."
I've been able to touch people in a way
that was never a goal of mine.
Before it was about I want to be a wrestler, period.
That's it.
You know, but now I realize I think, I have this reach.
So I would like to use that reach for good.
>> Man: I will be rooting for you in the UFC.
>> Punk: Oh, good. Thank you.
I'm going to be very prepared. It's going to be fun.
Hi, how are you?
Is this for me, or am I signing this?
>> It's for you.  >> Why are you crying?
>> Because I love you so much.
>> Punk: No, that's sweet of you.
But I don't like it when women cry.
Excellent.  >> Can I hug you?
>> You are too much.
You are too much, kiddo.
>> She bought the sweatshirt off your new line.
Now she's not going to wash it ever.
>> You should wash it.
If it gets dirty, let's just wash it.
>> So you're dad, then? >> Yeah
>> Right on.
I like to hear that stuff.
That's the whole purpose of doing this.
I know there are people that I don't know all over the world
that are pulling for me and are fans of me and yeah,
it's extremely important.
Yes, I'm doing this for me, absolutely,
100 percent all the way.
But if I inspire one person to do something that somebody
told them that they can't do, then we have all done our jobs.
>> Hit.
Put your head into it.
Get ready.
>> Punk: Because of the outside perception of me
being a pro wrestler and my body type and what not.
People are always harping on me,
"He's not even an athlete.
Blah, blah, blah."
I'm not the greatest athlete but I dare you to watch me
work for a day and tell me that I'm not an athlete.
That's why I don't discourage anybody.
If you love it and its something you want to do,
you have to do it.
>> Roufus: King of Wraslin' versus the king of wrestling.
Watch out, Ben is going to DDT you.
>> Askren: I love that one.
Boom!
>> [ bleep ] me.
>> I truly believe, PMA.
It's right there on my middle finger.
Positive mental attitude.
If I actually believe in myself
and I'm confident in my abilities
and I'm comfortable in those surroundings
and I visualize the right opponent
and I go through every single scenario in my head
and it's all positive, I'm going to win.
That's definitely an aspect of the fight game
I don't think a lot of fighters grasp.
>> First time for everything there, Mr. Punk.
>> I know, I love it.
>> Roufus: This is that feeling,
there is no turning back.
Once the hands are taped, it's happening.
I just want you to stay cool and do what you need to do.
You know this is first time.
Don't put pressure on yourself, trip out.
This is two months you have been training.
Most people we wouldn't put in that quick,
but, you know, you have the desire to do this.
>> I would say the biggest thing, trust what we've
been showing you, you know?
Don't doubt yourself.
It's like, trust it, you know.
>> Take your stage presence from, you know,
the wrestling industry and use it.
>> Roufus: Good.
Nice.
Doing good, coach.
He's looking good.
He's a gamer.
We are going to find out if he is a gamer.
Let's go.
>> Pettis: This is it.
Just like this with 18,000 people.
You've been here before.
You have been here before.
It's nothing.
>> Roufus: A lot of us know who Craig is,
he's a professional Welterweight fighter.
Decorated collegiate athlete.
So let's give it up for Craig.
[ cheering ]
This man needs no introduction.
The one and only, CM Punk.
[ cheering ]
Alright, let's go.
We're either winning or learning.
Fight!
Let's go.
Come on.
Good.
Hit and move. Hit and move.
Don't stay on him.
Nice. That's it.
There you go.
Good takedown.
>> Pettis: Whizzer. Whizzer! >> Roufus: Sprawl. Sprawl!
>> Pettis: You better move now,
you're losing the fight here.
>> Roufus: You got to get that underhook.
There you go. Get on your side.
Stand up.
>> Man: Don't give your back, stay there.
>> Pettis Watch your neck.
Watch your neck.
>> Roufus: Time.
Alright, to the corners.
>> Pettis: You lost that round based on just positioning.
If you don't have the technique off your back,
get your ass up.
You're losing the fight on your back.
>> Roufus: Fight!
>> Pettis: Stay long. Stay long!
Get low. Get low!
>> Roufus: That's it. Get moving.
Nice! There you go!
>> Pettis: Get your feet back.
Get your leg back.
Watch that choke.
Watch that choke.
It's too high.
>> Roufus: Alright. Tap.
Doing good though. Doing good, kid.
You are going against an experienced guy.
Fight!
You got to defend it.
>> Pettis: Defend that takedown.
>> Roufus: Defend. Defend. Defend.
>> Pettis: Use that cage. Use that cage.
>> Roufus: Good, Craig. There you go.
Keep fighting.
Watch the arm bar.
Step over.
Good.
>> Go. Go. Go.
[ epic music ]
>> Roufus: Watch the leg lock.
Good reversal, Craig.
Off your back. Come on, let's attack.
Hands together.
Tap.
Good. Alright.
This was his first fight,
so, I mean, I thought he did really good,
just you know-- you all know,
you are either winning or you are doing what?
[ crowd says "Learning" ] >> Roufus: Exactly.
So Craig wins this one tonight.
>> Good job.
> Roufus: You had to feel what it feels like, right?
>> We have a baseline.
>> Roufus: Here's the thing, my older brother was a world champ.
You know how many beatings I took from him before I got good.
>> I didn't have any delusions coming in here.
It wasn't like, "I'm going to knock this [bleep] out.
>> Roufus: No, no, I thought you did good.
>> I don't want to have the mentality always
that I'm going to survive.
>> I mean I'm happy.
I have never put anyone in that quick
after two months of training.
I don't care if they are BJJ black belt.
A world-class kickboxer.
I mean this was new territory for me.
So I was nervous doing this whole thing.
You did good though, I was proud of you.
>> Thanks, Duke.
>> You went with a real deal dude, you know.
>> Punk: I got the first three rounds under my belt.
Learn something everyday.
Get better everyday.
So when my fight does come, I will be the one winning.
[ Broken Record by Bouncing Souls ]
♪ Going to the  same ol' places ♪
♪ Skipping like  a broken record ♪
♪ I love you all  but I got to get out ♪
♪ Change this scenery ♪
♪ I tried to find some place  that seemed right for me ♪
>> Punk: This isn't pro wrestling.
This is actually real.
[ Bouncing Souls ]  ♪ When I lost my mind  the truth set me free ♪
>> Go faster, faster!
[ Bouncing Souls ]  ♪ Nowhere to run from myself ♪
♪ Nowhere to hide  from the truth ♪
♪ Nowhere to run from myself ♪
♪ Nowhere to hide  from the truth ♪
>> Yeah, there we go.
[ Bouncing Souls ] ♪ --Somebody to give myself to ♪
♪ Nowhere to run from myself ♪
♪ Nowhere to hide  from the truth ♪
♪ Nowhere to run from myself ♪
♪ Nowhere to hide  from the truth ♪
>> Punk: This is the biggest challenge
I have ever put in front of me.
I want to show the world what I know is inside of me.
[ Bouncing Souls ]  ♪ Set me free ♪
♪ Set me free ♪
>> Punk: This is their world.
[ Bouncing Souls ]  ♪ Set me free ♪
>> Punk I'm just getting started in it.
We are targeting like Welterweight 170
for me to fight at.
>> I'm not prepared for this.
>> Hello.
>> What's up, buddy. How are you?
>> Punk: To be successful at anything,
you have to be a little bit crazy.
